alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Major (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:20PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Dewey, southwestern Major and southeastern Woodward Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 120 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Cestos, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seiling, Mutual, Cestos, and Chester. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
